ext_descriptions.ext_description: A fatp_part_connected_terminals_definition_domain_enumeration lists the values of domain types for a .
specifies the domain type is electrical;
specifies the domain type is thermal;
specifies the domain type is optical;
specifies the domain type is magnetic.
An interface_or_join_terminal_enumeration defines the possible connection types for a .
specifies the connection type is to join at the same immediate assembly level.
specifies the connection type is to interface to the next-higher-assembly level.
The terminal_joint_type provides pre-defined s for s.

A Part_terminal is a type of
provided to support a specific, identified, feature on a product that may be used to access electrical or other domain functional aspects. A Part_teminal is associated with a specific version of a product. A Part_teminal is an element of the physical aspect of a product. A Part_teminal is often specified in an interface control document or other contractual binding agreement.
the text that provides further information about terminal type for the Part_terminal. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies that the Part_terminal is intended to join at the immediate-assembly level, or it is intended to interface to the next-higher-assembly level.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Part_terminal is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Part_terminal as its . There shall be no more than one
for a particular Part_terminal.
specifies the intended kind of joint of an occurrence of this Part_terminal with another Part_terminal by an . The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Part_terminal is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Part_terminal as its . There shall be no more than one
for a particular Part_terminal.

ext_description.p: A Part_connected_terminals_definition is the association between two or more that are connected internally to the part. This object serves as a formal requirement statement for connections implemented by a product. It is a topological abstraction in that it does not provide any information stating the variation of properties with respect to product or environmental variability.
ext_description.note: This object is included to support the case where multiple terminals of a part are connected internally. It provides a more compact model structure by permitting an application to populate one instance of Part_connected_terminals_definition instead of multiple instances of .
ext_description.example: A Part_connected_terminals_definition for a signal name of 'GND' specifies that J1-11, J2-1, J3-12, and J4 terminals 8 through 20 are all internally connected and that the interface control document specifies a common name of 'GND' for the specified Part_terminals.

A Part_connected_terminals_definition for a signal name of '28VDC' specifies that J11-11, J21-1, J31-12, and J14 terminals 8 through 20 are all internally connected and that the interface control document specifies a common name of '28VDC'' for the specified Part_terminals.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the words by which the Part_connected_terminals_definition is known.
specifies a role of the for the Part_connected_terminals_definition. There shall be two or more for a Part_connected_terminals_definition.
specifies the that is the product definition for the Part_connected_terminals_definition.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Part_connected_terminals_definition is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Part_connected_terminals_definition as its . There shall be no more than one
for a particular Part_connected_terminals_definition.
All terminals specified by the connected_terminals shall be on the associated_definition.
All terminals specified by the member of this object shall be mapped to the same terminal of the functional definition.
The combination of name and associated_definition shall be unique within a population of Part_connected_terminals_definitions.

A Part_connected_terminals_definition_domain is is the application of a domain name to a
to support cases where domains other than pure electrical are required. If a Part_connected_terminals_definition_domain is not applied to a , the
of the
shall be interpreted to be electrical.

specifies the role of the
for the Part_connected_terminals_definition_domain.

specifies the role of the
for the Part_connected_terminals_definition_domain.

A Part_connected_terminals_element is a the object that describes a link between two nodes for the graph representation. A node may be referenced by more than one link. A node may be either a terminal or a topological junction.
the words by which the Part_connected_terminals_element is known.

specifies a role of the
for the Part_connected_terminals_element.

specifies a role of the
for the Part_connected_terminals_element.

specifies a role of the
for the Part_connected_terminals_element.
The combination of name and connectivity_context shall be unique within a population of Part_connected_terminals_element.
The start_terminus shall not be equal to the end_terminus.
A Part_connected_terminals_layout_topology_requirement_assignment is a type of .

an attribute inherited from the
shall be redeclared as the
for the Part_connected_terminals_layout_topology_requirement_assignment.

an attribute inherited from the
shall be redeclared as the
for the Part_connected_terminals_layout_topology_requirement_assignment.

A Part_connected_terminals_structure_definition is a type of
that has a structure. Structure included supports assignment of path based properties to a
for routing or validation purposes. The structure is a graph and may be a tree if there are no redundant arcs, but that is not a requirement. The arcs in the graph are the
referenced by the structural_element attribute. The nodes in the graph may be either a terminal or a topological junction.

specifies a role of the
for the Part_connected_terminals_structure_definition. There shall exist zero or more Part_terminals for the Part_connected_terminals_structure_definition.

specifies a role of the
for the Part_connected_terminals_structure_definition. There shall exist zero or more Part_connected_terminals_topological_junctions for the Part_connected_terminals_structure_definition.
specifies a LOGICAL value.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Part_connected_terminals_structure_definition is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Part_connected_terminals_structure_definition as its . There shall be no more than one
for a particular Part_connected_terminals_structure_definition.

ext_description.p:
Each member of structural_terminal_nodes shall be in the set of
inherited from P .

The size of the set of structural_terminal_nodes shall be the size of the set of

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Part_connected_terminals_topological_junction is used when at least three
are connected and the explicit topology must be stated.
the words by which the Part_connected_terminals_topological_junction is known.

specifies a role of the
for the Part_connected_terminals_topological_junction.
The combination of name and scope shall be unique within a population of Part_connected_terminals_topological_junction.

A Functional_usage_view_to_part_terminal_assignment is the association between a and a . This is the fundamental mechanism for mapping between the functional view and the physical view of a design or library item.
specifies a role of the for the Functional_usage_view_to_part_terminal_assignment.
specifies a role of the for the Functional_usage_view_to_part_terminal_assignment.
The combination of functional_usage_view_terminal and physical_usage_view_terminal shall be unique within a population of Functional_usage_view_to_part_terminal_assignment.
